reviews.text: Really enjoyed staying at the Novotel. Check in was pretty painless. We were first offered rooms on different floors from our teenagers but after insisting that was not appropriate the staff did their upmost to at least put us on the same floor. we were on the 11th floor. our rooms were lovely, the king size bed was enormous with crisp, clean linen. Lots of nice extras in the bathroom, inluding complimentary toothbrushes, paste, mouthwash etc.

reviews.text: Novotel Clarke Quay is one of the best Novotel's we have stayed at (and we have stayed at a lot of them). The location is great with the MRT not too far away, dining options so close and nearby to a lot of the major attractions. On arrival reception advised us we needed to check in on the premier floor and escorted us up to the lounge there. As soon as we entered they greeted us by name, offered us a drink and checked us in. Our room there was fantastic and well decorated with a bathroom with a seperate shower as well as a shower over the bath. Service was efficient whenever we requested anything and as for the premier lounge staff nothing was too much trouble for them. The lounge was a great place to relax after a hot day out with a varied range of food and complimentary alcohol between 6 - 8pm with soft drink and coffee available during lounge opening hours. Breakfast was relaxing in the lounge but if you wanted a wider variety we could eat at the restaraunt downstairs which was also very good. Overall this is a great hotel in a great location and we will be staying there again next time we go to singapore
reviews.title: Great location...great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel on 25th April for two nights. We were given an updgrade due to a double booking error when we arrived. We were on the 24th floor but not entitled to breakfast or the Bizz Room. The hotel room was small but comfortable, not much room for hanging your clothes but the bathroom was a nice size. The hotel was next to the river so it was ideal for going out on the riverside, although we found it very expensive to eat and drink. The pool was nice although we went down twice and found we couldnt get a bed so had to use a chair which isnt ideal when you want to have a sleep or sunbathe. Singapore MRT is cheap and ideal as the station is only five mins away and Taxis are cheap but for eating out and drinking it is expensive I would say more expensive than London. There is a supermarket next to the hotel where you may want to buy cold cans to put in the mini bar as drinks in the mini bar are over £2.00 for a can of 7UP. Weather was fantastic, but very humid. A nice break to break up a long journey home back to the UK, clean city but be prepared for expensive eating and drinking. Approx £14 for two

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn't get off to a good start arriving at this Novotel. Due to a late flight our arrival was several hours later than expected at 3am. So all we wanted to do was get to our room and sleep ! The staff member and porter on duty were very friendly and we were checked in very quickly. We had an accor card so had been granted an upgrade to the Club rooms at the hotels discretion. We get up to our room and were not amused to find two single beds despite requesting a King (and the fact that the girl on reception could see that my wife and I were a couple). So I told the porter to turn around and back down to reception we went. She was very apologetic and quickly arranged us a king room (one floor higher on about the 24th Floor I think). Despite being tired we were very impressed with this room and the view in particular. The lighting controls were especially good with a comprehensive control panel including night lights many different lighting combinations that you don't usually get. I left the room at about 9am to check Club lounge and find out what time breakfast was until. We had stayed on club floors before and you normally get access to this lounge and breakfast etc. However upon entering and giving my room number the pleasant (but very officious) staff member told me that as I had been given a complimentary upgrade I was not entitled to have breakfast in the cluib lounge or to use the facilities even though I was staying on the club floor. Given there was no one else there I found this a little odd and whilst fair enough you would think that a hotel of this calibre would show a little discretion. That aside, we loved the room and the hotel allowed us a late check-out until 2pm so we could sleep in. The bathroom was opulent and huge and the bath was also large. Only real negative about the room was the fact that you couldn't get onto the small balcony. Beds were also very comfortable. The hotel is very close to Clark quay and the associated nightlife and even on the 24th floor we could hear the music when we arrived. We really enjoyed our stay in this hotel despite the minor glitches and loved the restaurants and bars across the road. The hotel is not too far from the subway for travel to the airport (about 5 minutes walk). Didn't try the bar or restaurants but they looked expensive compared to the range of venues at clark quay. Overall a good quality hotel

A pleasant end to a nice holiday
reviews.text: Novotel is a comfortable hotel at a prime location. The room rates are a bit high compared to other hotels in the vicinity. Internet/WiFi charges @ SGD 30 per night are also higher than what other hotels charge.

reviews.title: Very impressed with the Novotel
reviews.text: We have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Novotel. We have been to Singapore many times and stayed at a different hotel. The Novotel were offering good rates so we decided on this for a change. I was very impressed with the size of the room, we had 3 double beds and the room still had plenty of room. The Biz floor is definitely worth the extra. The staff were fantastic, free internet, nibbles and drinks for most of the day. The location is great, the view from our room and the Biz floor was the best we have seen of Singapore generally. I would highly recommend this hotel. Just ask to be on the river side of the hotel because we did stay one night on our return on the other side and must admit could hear music and we were on the 24 floor.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Novotel Clarke Quay Singapore from the 14th - 16th February 2008 and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Check in was smooth and the service was fantastic, particularly from John who was most professional and welcoming during check in and out. We were upgraded to a large room on floor 23 (with access to the business centre) and had a terrific view of the river and Clarke Quay. The hotel was well located and only a short walk to the MRT (although we mostly took very cheap taxi rides to the nearby attractions as our conversations with the cab drivers were always very informative!) and we were within a stone's throw of plenty of live entertainment and good restaurants along the river. Our room was spotless and very comfortable, and as it was included in our rate, we enjoyed a lovely buffet breakfast at the hotel both mornings overlooking the pool area. There is some construction going on at the base of the hotel (in the attached shopping mall) but this didn't affect our stay at all. Overall, the service from all staff, location and quality of the hotel made our stay most enjoyable and I would stay here again without hesitation.
reviews.title: Highly recommended

reviews.text: We have just arrived back in Cairns Australia this morning after spending the last four nights at Novotel Clark Quay. For location, service and cleanliness this hotel is up with the best. When I was in the process of booking hotels in Singapore I was concerned of reports of hotels not bing clean, smelling of smoke and being old and needing refurbishing so when I booked the Novotel I went for a deluxe room. My concerns were not headed at this establishment as not one of the above problems is in this hotel. The staff are frindly and the buffet breakfast and lunch are sensational. It is only a $7.00 taxi ride to most of the major shopping centres and eating is not a problem because at your doorstop on Clark Quay are some of the best eateries you will find. A must see is the flying angel at Divine Wine Bar, the building is magnificent and the angel that flies to get your selected bottle of wine will be one of the highlights of your Singapore visit.
reviews.title: Great location Fantastic Hotel

reviews.text: Great hotel. Upgraded to a suite ( 2 adults, 2 ten year olds), upon arrival - it was worth it. Huuuuuuge bed in bedroom, we all got into it for a couple of hours when we arrived and slept comfortably!!!!

Nice, clean hotel
reviews.text: The hotel has been recently done up. All very clean and modern. All of the rooms were great with everything you need. All of the staff were very friendly and very funny.

reviews.title: Very nice hotel
reviews.text: Saturday night was our arrival and we came to find the whole of Clarke Quay lit up with lights and busselling with people.

The only odd thing I noticed was that every day, the fire alarm would go off. It wasn't noisy or anything, just a few second beeping noise, but I did get worried at first. After about a minute, they announced that they were investigating the situation and not to panic. And after another minute, they would say it was a false alarm. Now this happened all three days we were there. Maybe they were just checking it to make sure it worked, or maybe something was wrong with their system, but I don't think you should be too alarmed if it does go off when you're there!
reviews.title: Great Hotel to Stay

reviews.text: The pool was nice, but couldn't go to the gym because of the renovations. They did say we could use the gym in the apartment or something next door, but we didn't. Other than that, our stay at Novotel was great and I have no real complaints. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Singapore as the location was amazing and I'd also stay there again if I ever visit Singapore. (In fact, I've already told my dad to stay there on his next trip). Excellent choice!
reviews.title: nice place

reviews.title: Great location and comfortable rooms

aka: Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay Hotel Singapore
description: Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay combines convenience and comfort in the center of town. This 4-star hotel is the perfect choice for your next business trip or holiday, and is located close to the famous shopping paradise of Orchard Road and the Suntec City Convention Center. Featuring 403 beautifully appointed rooms, plus a Premier Lounge, Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay offers great conference facilities, plus an outdoor swimming pool, a bar, and three restaurants serving local and international cuisine.
